DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the top value of the range for total bilirubin falling within parameters set forth by the guidelines for a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for total bilirubin, bilirubin is a breakdown product of hemoglobin and total bilirubin is measured to screen for or to monitor liver or gall bladder dysfunction, falling within parameters set forth by the action plan and guidelines for a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:Bilirubin is a breakdown product of hemoglobin. Total and direct bilirubin are usually measured to screen for or to monitor liver or gall bladder dysfunction. (from MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia)

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <= 2.0 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <= ULN unless the patient has a grade 1 bilirubin elevation (> ULN to 1.5 x ULN) resulting from Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome due to slow conjugation of bilirubin

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <=1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <=1.5 x Institutional Upper Limit of Normal (ULN) unless due to Gilbert's disease.  If total bilirubin is >1.5 x ULN, a direct bilirubin should be performed and must be <1.5 mg/dL for Gilbert's disease to be diagnosed

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <=1.5 x ULN, or if total bilirubin is >1.5 ULN, the direct bilirubin must be normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin =< upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x institutional limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin within normal institutional limits

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <= 2.0 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin <1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (Bilirubin <3 x institutional upper limit of normal for Gilbert's syndrome)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin within normal institutional limits <= 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin within normal institutional limits < 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN within 14 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study serum bilirubin greater than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin greater than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Direct bilirubin <= ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels > 1.5 ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Direct bilirubin <= institutional ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels >1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Bilirubin <1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin within normal institutional limits <1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (Bilirubin <3 x institutional upper limit of normal for Gilbert's syndrome)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum total bilirubin <= 1.5 x institutional ULN (Values post biliary stenting are allowed for eligibility).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (upper limit of normal) for the lab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is bilirubin <= 2.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total serum bilirubin level <= 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the lab or direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total serum bilirubin level lower than or equal to 1.5 x ULN? (Patient's with known Gilbert's disease who have bilirubin level lower than or equal to 3 x ULN may be enrolled)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total serum bilirubin level lower than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the lab or direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x ULN, within 14 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin level less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin less than or equal to ULN (upper limit of normal) for the lab within 28 days before study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin less than or equal to ULN (upper limit of normal) for the lab within 28 days before randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin level less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin level less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) within 14 days prior to second registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's total bilirubin less than or equal to 4 x ULN (upper limit of normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin level less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for the lab within 16 weeks prior to pre-entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin less than or equal to ULN (upper limit of normal) for the lab within 28 days before Step 1/Study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin level less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin level less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?
